docs.abstract: A Philadelphia neighborhood is the largest open-air narcotics market for heroin on the East Coast. Addicts come from all over, and many never leave.
docs.snippet: A Philadelphia neighborhood is the largest open-air narcotics market for heroin on the East Coast. Addicts come from all over, and many never leave.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first time Mark shot up “Philly dope” was in the summer of 2017, with his girlfriend, Sarah. They had been on their way from Massachusetts to South Carolina, hoping to get clean there and find someplace cheap to live. The plan was to detox slowly on the way. In New Jersey, they needed to buy more drugs, just enough to make it to Myrtle Beach. Mark got out his phone and Googled “really bad drug areas.” A neighborhood in Philadelphia came up: Kensington.

docs.abstract: Con artistry can charm us as much as it enrages us. And lately, it seems ubiquitous.
docs.snippet: Con artistry can charm us as much as it enrages us. And lately, it seems ubiquitous.
docs.lead_paragraph: The two most jarring events in the past decade of American life both had the whiff of a grand con about them. One was the crisis of 2008, after which a lot of ordinary Americans turned their attention to the financial-services industry and discovered something that looked, on the surface, uncannily like a classic bilking: There was a lot of hard-to-follow shifting about of who owned what and who owed what to whom, and in the end a lot of people found that their retirement savings had vanished. The other was the election of Donald Trump, who has always been fairly open about his talent for old-school hucksterism. To the very end, many people were convinced his entire campaign had been a long-game self-promotional exercise — a man wandering past real estate, casinos, reality television, mail-order steaks and wealth-building seminars to arrive at right-wing politics as a high-quality grift.

headline.main: Why Are We Suddenly Surrounded by ‘Grift’?

docs.abstract: Making sense of the president’s emotional state is now a media obsession, but how much is there really to understand?
docs.snippet: Making sense of the president’s emotional state is now a media obsession, but how much is there really to understand?
docs.lead_paragraph: “Let’s start with the state of Donald Trump,” Fox News’s Chris Wallace said at the outset of the president’s latest on-camera interview, on Nov. 17, in the manner of a support-group facilitator pausing for a little check-in before an unpacking of recent events. “How dark is your mood?”

headline.main: On the Trump-Mood Beat — But Why?

docs.abstract: Share a story and a photograph of someone close to you who died this year. A number of submissions will be chosen for publication.
docs.snippet: Share a story and a photograph of someone close to you who died this year. A number of submissions will be chosen for publication.
docs.lead_paragraph: As part of the magazine’s annual The Lives They Lived issue, we invite readers to contribute a photograph and a story of a loved one who died this year. A number of submissions will be chosen to be published on The New York Times Magazine website. Entries are limited to 400 words and must be submitted by Dec. 24, 2018, to be eligible for consideration.

headline.main: The Lives They Loved: Submit Your Memories

byline.original: By The New York Times Magazine

docs.abstract: In a time of omnipresent digital images, books remain one of the most powerful ways of showing the riches of photography.
docs.snippet: In a time of omnipresent digital images, books remain one of the most powerful ways of showing the riches of photography.
docs.lead_paragraph: A photo book is a stubbornly old-fashioned technology. It allows for some experimentation, with scale, paper and color, but it is ultimately a sequence of photographs printed on paper and bound into a portable volume. In a time of a torrential flow of online photographs and omnipresent video, such material simplicity is almost quaint. But a form invented in the mid-19th century remains one of the most vivid ways of conveying the power of images.
